info.name: Aerofox Transparent
info.description:
Tired of never seeing your desktop background because your browser is always open and maximized? Try this. 

Based on "Discreet Transparency" by Satoz and "About:Blank Glass" by foxxyn8, which I combined and built upon to create a minimalistic style close to the classic Firefox, but totally transparent, in the spirit of Windows 7 Aero.

If you installed this style, please take the time to review it and leave your feedback.
info.additionalInfo:
This style is designed for Windows 7 with Aero effects turned on. To enjoy it fully, your start page and new tab preferences should be set to open a blank page.

2012-07-01: Modified for compatibility with Fx 13. Haven't figured out how to make the background of the new tab transparent while keeping the thumbnails visible yet. Adjusted the transparency of the whole page to 50%. Change 'opacity' under '#main-window[stylish-url="about:newtab"]' to 0 if you want it fully transparent (you won't be able to see the thumbnails) or 1 if you want it fully opaque.

2012-02-28: Did some clean-up. Changed name from "Total Transparency" because some people found it misleading (no, the dialog boxes and page backgrounds are not transparent, because there is always a point where it becomes hard to read and inconvenient). Also created a new style, even more transparent: http://userstyles.org/styles/61608

2012-01-14: Adjusted tab and toolbar shading to make selected tab more recognizable and create a discreet separation between tabs and navbar.
